metadata.title: CVE-2017-10929 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The grub_memmove function in shlr/grub/kern/misc.c in radare2 1.5.0 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflowand application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted binary file, possibly related to a read overflow in thegrub_disk_read_small_real function in kern/disk.c in GNU GRUB 2.02.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-3.2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
